str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A fault, sin, evil deed. From hamartano; a sin.
Abusive or scurrilous language, blasphemy. From blasphemos; vilification.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.
